info.title: ChirpStack Application Server REST API
info.description:
For more information about the usage of the ChirpStack Application Server (REST) API, see
[https://www.chirpstack.io/application-server/api/](https://www.chirpstack.io/application-server/api/).

parameters.description: Max number of applications to return in the result-test.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: ID of the organization to filter on.
parameters.name: organizationID

get.summary: List lists the available applications.

parameters.description:
Application ID.
This will be automatically assigned on create.
parameters.name: application.id

get.summary: ListIntegrations lists all configured integrations.

delete.summary: DeleteAWSSNSIntegration deletes the AWS SNS application-integration.

get.summary: GetAWSSNSIntegration returns the AWS SNS application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteAzureServiceBusIntegration deletes the Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

get.summary: GetAzureServiceBusIntegration returns the Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteGCPPubSubIntegration deletes the GCP PubSub application-integration.

get.summary: GetGCPPubSubIntegration returns the GCP PubSub application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteIntegration deletes the HTTP application-integration.

get.summary: GetHTTPIntegration returns the HTTP application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteInfluxDBIntegration deletes the InfluxDB application-integration.

get.summary: GetInfluxDBIntegration returns the InfluxDB application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteLoRaCloudIntegration deletes the LoRaCloud application-integration.

get.summary: GetLoRaCloudIntegration returns the LoRaCloud application-integration.

post.summary:
GenerateMQTTIntegrationClientCertificate generates an application ID specific TLS certificate
to connect to the MQTT broker.

delete.summary: DeleteMyDevicesIntegration deletes the MyDevices application-integration.

get.summary: GetMyDevicesIntegration returns the MyDevices application-integration.

delete.summary: DeletePilotThingsIntegration deletes the Pilot Things application-integration.

get.summary: GetPilotThingsIntegration returns the Pilot Things application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteThingsBoardIntegration deletes the ThingsBoard application-integration.

get.summary: GetThingsBoardIntegration returns the ThingsBoard application-integration.

parameters.description: Max number of devices to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Multicast-group ID to filter on (string formatted UUID).
parameters.name: multicastGroupID

parameters.description: Service-profile ID to filter on (string formatted UUID).
parameters.name: serviceProfileID

get.summary: ListLastRxByApplicationID lists the devices by the given application ID, sorted by the name of the device.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the given application.

get.summary: Get returns the requested application.

post.summary: CreateAWSSNSIntegration creates a AWS SNS application-integration.

put.summary: UpdateAWSSNSIntegration updates the AWS SNS application-integration.

post.summary: CreateAzureServiceBusIntegration creates an Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

put.summary: UpdateAzureServiceBusIntegration updates the Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

post.summary: CreateGCPPubSubIntegration creates a GCP PubSub application-integration.

put.summary: UpdateGCPPubSubIntegration updates the GCP PubSub application-integration.

post.summary: CreatePilotThingsIntegration creates an Pilot Things application-integration.

put.summary: UpdatePilotThingsIntegration updates the Pilot Things application-integration.

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: List lists the available device-profiles.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the device-profile matching the given id.

get.summary: Get returns the device-profile matching the given id.

parameters.description: Max number of devices to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Multicast-group ID to filter on (string formatted UUID).
parameters.name: multicastGroupID

parameters.description: Service-profile ID to filter on (string formatted UUID).
parameters.name: serviceProfileID

get.summary: List returns the available devices.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the device matching the given DevEUI.

get.summary: Get returns the device matching the given DevEUI.

delete.summary: Deactivate de-activates the device.

get.summary: GetActivation returns the current activation details of the device (OTAA and ABP).

delete.summary:
ClearDeviceNonces deletes the device older activation records for the given DevEUI.
  * These are clear older DevNonce records from device activation records in Network Server
  * These clears all DevNonce records but keeps latest 20 records for maintain device activation status

get.summary:
StreamEventLogs stream the device events (uplink payloads, ACKs, joins, errors).
  * This endpoint is intended for debugging only.
  * This endpoint does not work from a web-browser.

StreamFrameLogs streams the uplink and downlink frame-logs for the given DevEUI.
  * These are the raw LoRaWAN frames and this endpoint is intended for debugging only.
  * This endpoint does not work from a web-browser.

post.summary: CreateForDevice creates a deployment for the given DevEUI.
GetRandomDevAddr returns a random DevAddr taking the NwkID prefix into account.

delete.summary: DeleteKeys deletes the device-keys for the given DevEUI.

get.summary: GetKeys returns the device-keys for the given DevEUI.
GetLastRxInfo returns the LastRxInfo for the given DevEUI.

delete.summary: Flush flushes the downlink device-queue.

parameters.description: Return only the count, not the result-set.
parameters.name: countOnly

get.summary: List lists the items in the device-queue.

post.summary: Sesion key creat the device (for LoRaWAN MAC versionâ€‰ 1.0).

parameters.description:
Aggregation interval.  One of "second", "minute", "hour", "day", "week",
"month", "quarter", "year".  Case insensitive.
parameters.name: interval

get.summary: GetStats returns the device stats.

put.summary: Update updates the device matching the given DevEUI.

post.summary: Activate (re)activates the device with the given parameters (for ABP or for importing OTAA activations).
Enqueue adds the given item to the device-queue.

parameters.description: Max number of deployments to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: List lists the fuota deployments.

parameters.description:
ID of the deployment (string formatted UUID).
This value will be automatically assigned on create.
parameters.name: fuota_deployment_id

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: ListDeploymentDevices lists the devices (and status) for the given fuota deployment ID.

parameters.description:
ID of the deployment (string formatted UUID).
This value will be automatically assigned on create.
parameters.name: fuota_deployment_id

get.summary: GetDeploymentDevice returns the deployment device.

parameters.description:
ID of the deployment (string formatted UUID).
This value will be automatically assigned on create.
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Get returns the fuota deployment for the given id.

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: List returns the existing gateway-profiles.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the gateway-profile matching the given id.

get.summary: Get returns the gateway-profile matching the given id.

parameters.description: Max number of nodes to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
ID of the organization for which to filter on, when left blank the
response will return all gateways to which the user has access to.
parameters.name: organizationID

parameters.description: Search on name or gateway MAC (optional).
parameters.name: search

get.summary: List lists the gateways.

put.summary: Update updates the gateway matching the given mac address.

get.summary:
StreamFrameLogs streams the uplink and downlink frame-logs for the given gateway ID.
Notes:
  * These are the raw LoRaWAN frames and this endpoint is intended for debugging only.
  * This endpoint does not work from a web-browser.

post.summary:
GenerateGatewayClientCertificate returns TLS certificate gateway authentication / authorization.
This endpoint can ony be used when ChirpStack Network Server is configured with a gateway
CA certificate and key, which is used for signing the TLS certificate. The returned TLS
certificate will have the Gateway ID as Common Name.

get.summary: GetLastPing returns the last emitted ping and gateways receiving this ping.

parameters.description:
Aggregation interval.  One of "second", "minute", "hour", "day", "week",
"month", "quarter", "year".  Case insensitive.
parameters.name: interval

get.summary: GetStats lists the gateway stats given the query parameters.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the gateway matching the given mac address.

get.summary: Get returns the gateway for the requested mac address.

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: ListAPIKeys lists the available API keys.

post.summary: CreateAPIKey creates the given API key.

delete.summary: DeleteAPIKey deletes the API key.

get.summary: GetDevicesSummary returns an aggregated summary of the devices.
GetGatewaysSummary returns an aggregated summary of the gateways.
OpenID Connect login.
Get the current user's profile

parameters.description: Max number of results to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset offset of the result-set (for pagination).
parameters.name: offset

get.summary: Perform a global search.
Get the global settings.

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Device EUI (HEX encoded string) to filter on.
parameters.name: devEUI

parameters.description: Search can be used to search on the multicast-group name.
parameters.name: search

get.summary: List lists the available multicast-groups.

delete.summary: Delete deletes a multicast-group given an ID.

get.summary: Get returns a multicast-group given an ID.

parameters.description:
ID (string formatted UUID).
This will be generated automatically on create.
parameters.name: multicast_group.id

post.summary: AddDevice adds the given device to the multicast-group.

delete.summary: RemoveDevice removes the given device from the multicast-group.
FlushQueue flushes the multicast-group queue.

get.summary: ListQueue lists the items in the multicast-group queue.

post.summary: Enqueue adds the given item to the multicast-queue.

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: List lists the available network-servers.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the network-server matching the given id.

get.summary: Get returns the network-server matching the given id.
GetADRAlgorithms returns the available ADR algorithms.

parameters.description: Max number of organizations to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
When provided, the given string will be used to search on
displayName.
parameters.name: search

get.summary: Get organization list.

delete.summary: Delete an organization.

get.summary: Get data for a particular organization.

parameters.description: Max number of users to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Get organization's user list.

delete.summary: Delete a user from an organization.

get.summary: Get data for a particular organization user.

post.summary: Add a new user to an organization. The user is matched based on email, not user id.

put.summary: Update a user in an organization.

parameters.description: Max number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: List lists the available service-profiles.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the service-profile matching the given id.

get.summary: Get returns the service-profile matching the given id.

parameters.description:
Service-profile ID (UUID string).
This will be automatically set on create.
parameters.name: service_profile.id

parameters.description: Max number of user to return in the result-set.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Get user list.

delete.summary: Delete a user.

get.summary: Get data for a particular user.

parameters.description:
User ID.
Will be set automatically on create.
parameters.name: user.id

applicationID.description:
Application ID.
In case the API key is to manage resources within an application, set
this to the ID of this application.message

id.description:
API key ID.
This value will be automatically generated on create.

organizationID.description:
Organization ID.
In case this API key is to manage resources within a single organization
set this to the ID of this organization.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

devEUI.description:
Device EUI (HEX encoded string).
Note that the device and the multicast-group must share the same
application ID.

id.description:
Application ID.
This will be automatically assigned on create.

name.description: Name of the application (must be unique).

organizationID.description:
ID of the organization to which the application belongs.
After create, this can not be modified.

payloadCodec.description:
Payload codec.
NOTE: These field have moved to the device-profile and will be removed
in the next major release. When set, the device-profile payload_ fields
have priority over the application payload_ fields.

payloadDecoderScript.description:
Payload decoder script.
NOTE: These field have moved to the device-profile and will be removed
in the next major release. When set, the device-profile payload_ fields
have priority over the application payload_ fields.

payloadEncoderScript.description:
Payload encoder script.
NOTE: These field have moved to the device-profile and will be removed
in the next major release. When set, the device-profile payload_ fields
have priority over the application payload_ fields.

organizationID.description: ID of the organization to which the application belongs.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

publishName.description:
Publish name.
This is the name of the topic or queue.

jwtToken.description: JWT token for this API Key.

id.description: ID of the created deployment (string formatted UUID).
ID of created group (string formatted UUID).

organizations.description: Add the user to the following organizations.

applicationID.description:
ID of the application to which the device must be added.
It is possible to move a device to a different application on update,
given that both the old and the new application share the same
service-profile.

name.description: Name of the device (if left blank, it will be set to the DevEUI).

referenceAltitude.description:
Reference altitude.
When using geolocation, this altitude will be used as a reference
(when supported by the geolocation-server) to increase geolocation
accuracy.

skipFCntCheck.description: Skip frame-counter checks (this is insecure, but could be helpful for debugging).

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags are exposed in the event payloads or to integration. Tags are
intended for aggregation and filtering.

variables.description:
Variables (user defined).
These variables can be used together with integrations to store tokens /
secrets that must be configured per device. These variables are not
exposed in the event payloads.

fNwkSIntKey.description: Forwarding network session integrity key (HEX encoded).

sNwkSIntKey.description: Serving network session integrity key (HEX encoded).

appKey.description:
Application root key (HEX encoded).
Note: This field only needs to be set for LoRaWAN 1.1.x devices!

genAppKey.description:
Gen application key (HEX encoded).
This is an optional key that only must be set for LORaWAN 1.0.x devices
that implement the remote multicast setup specification.

nwkKey.description:
Network root key (HEX encoded).
Note: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x, use this field for the LoRaWAN 1.0.x 'AppKey`!

deviceProfileID.description: Device-profile ID attached to the device.

deviceStatusBattery.description:
The device battery status (deprecated, use device_status_battery_level).
0:      The end-device is connected to an external power source
1..254: The battery level, 1 being at minimum and 254 being at maximum
255:    The end-device was not able to measure the battery level
256:    The device-status is not available.

deviceStatusBatteryLevel.description: Device battery level as a percentage.

deviceStatusExternalPowerSource.description: Device is connected to an external power source.

deviceStatusMargin.description:
The device margin status
-32..32: The demodulation SNR ration in dB
256:     The device-status is not available.

lastSeenAt.description:
The last time the application-server received any data from the device,
or an empty string when the device never sent any data.

adrAlgorithmID.description:
ADR algorithm ID.
In case this is left blank, or is configured to a non-existing ADR
algorithm (plugin), then it falls back to 'default'.

classBTimeout.description: Maximum delay for the End-Device to answer a MAC request or a confirmed DL frame (mandatory if class B mode supported).

classCTimeout.description: Maximum delay for the End-Device to answer a MAC request or a confirmed DL frame (mandatory if class C mode supported).

factoryPresetFreqs.description: List of factory-preset frequencies (mandatory for ABP).

geolocBufferTTL.description:
Geolocation buffer TTL (in seconds).
When > 0, uplink RX meta-data will be stored in a buffer so that
the meta-data of multiple uplinks can be used for geolocation.

geolocMinBufferSize.description:
Geolocation minimum buffer size.
When > 0, geolocation will only be performed when the buffer has
at least the given size.

macVersion.description: Version of the LoRaWAN supported by the End-Device.

maxDutyCycle.description: Maximum duty cycle supported by the End-Device.

maxEIRP.description: Maximum EIRP supported by the End-Device.

networkServerID.description: Network-server ID on which the service-profile is provisioned.

organizationID.description: Organization ID to which the service-profile is assigned.

payloadCodec.description:
Payload codec.
Leave blank to disable the codec feature.

payloadDecoderScript.description:
Payload decoder script.
Depending the codec, it is possible to provide a script which implements
the decoder function.

payloadEncoderScript.description:
Payload encoder script.
Depending the codec, it is possible to provide a script which implements
the encoder function.

pingSlotDR.description: Mandatory if class B mode supported.

pingSlotFreq.description: Mandatory if class B mode supported.

pingSlotPeriod.description: Mandatory if class B mode supported.

regParamsRevision.description: Revision of the Regional Parameters document supported by the End-Device.

rxDROffset1.description: RX1 data rate offset (mandatory for ABP).

rxDelay1.description: Class A RX1 delay (mandatory for ABP).

supports32BitFCnt.description: End-Device uses 32bit FCnt (mandatory for LoRaWAN 1.0 End-Device).

uplinkInterval.description:
Uplink interval.
This defines the expected uplink interval which the device uses for
communication. When the uplink interval has expired and no uplink has
been received, the device is considered inactive.

confirmed.description:
Set this to true when an acknowledgement from the device is required.
Please note that this must not be used to guarantee a delivery.

data.description:
Base64 encoded data.
Or use the json_object field when an application codec has been configured.

fCnt.description:
Downlink frame-counter.
This will be automatically set on enquue.

jsonObject.description:
JSON object (string).
Only use this when an application codec has been configured that can convert
this object into binary form.

gwRssi.description: Average RSSI (as reported by the gateway(s)).

gwSnr.description: Average SNR (as reported by the gateway(s)).

groupType.description:
Multicast type.
Currently only Class-C is supported!

id.description:
ID of the deployment (string formatted UUID).
This value will be automatically assigned on create.

multicastTimeout.description:
Multicast time-out.
Please refer to the Remote Multicast Setup specification as this field
has a different meaning for Class-B and Class-C groups.

nextStepAfter.description:
Next step after.
This value will be automatically set on create.

state.description:
Deployment state.
This value will be automatically set on create.

unicastTimeout.description:
Unicast time-out.
Set this to the value in which you at least expect an uplink frame from the
device. The FUOTA deployment engine will wait at least for the given time
before proceeding with the next steps.

errorMessage.description: Error message (in case of error state).

apiFUOTADeploymentDeviceState.description:
- PENDING: Pending.
 - SUCCESS: Success.
 - ERROR: Error.

id.description: ID of the deployment (string formatted UUID).

credentialsFile.description:
Credentials file.
This IAM service-account credentials file (JSON) must have the following Pub/Sub roles:
* Pub/Sub Publisher

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

topicName.description:
Topic name.
This is the name of the Pub/Sub topic.

boards.description:
Gateway boards configuration (optional).
This is (currently) only needed when the gateway supports the fine-timestamp
and you you would like to add the FPGA ID to the gateway meta-data or would
like ChirpStack Network Server to decrypt the fine-timestamp.

discoveryEnabled.description: Set to true to enable gateway discovery.

networkServerID.description: Network-server ID on which the gateway is provisioned.

organizationID.description:
Organization ID to which the gateway belongs.
This can't be changed after creating the gateway.

fpgaID.description: FPGA ID of the gateway (HEX encoded) (optional).

channels.description:
Default channels (channels specified by the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters
specification) enabled for this configuration.

extraChannels.description:
Extra channels added to the channel-configuration (in case the LoRaWAN
region supports adding custom channels).

statsInterval.description:
Stats interval.
This defines the (expected) stats interval which the gateways using this
gateway-profile are using.

spreadingFactors.description: Spreading factors (in case of LoRa modulation).

networkServerID.description: Network-server ID on which the gateway-profile is provisioned.

rxPacketsReceivedOK.description: Packets received by the gateway that passed the CRC check.

txPacketsReceived.description: Packets received by the gateway for transmission.

expiresAt.description: Expires at defines the expiration date of the certificate.
Expires at defines the expiration date of the certificate.

LastRx.description: receiving One of the best the last uplink message.

deviceStatusBattery.description:
The device battery status
0:      The end-device is connected to an external power source
1..254: The battery level, 1 being at minimum and 254 being at maximum
255:    The end-device was not able to measure the battery level
256:    The device-status is not available.

deviceStatusMargin.description:
The device margin status
-32..32: The demodulation SNR ration in dB
256:     The device-status is not available.

location.description:
Device location.
This will set when the network-server was able to resolve the location
using the geolocation-server.

drCount.description:
per data-rate count.
Devices that have never been seen are excluded.

region.description: The ChirpStack Network Server region configured.

apiGetOrganizationUserResponse.description: Response for a user in the organization

ackNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for ACK notifications (for confirmed downlink data).
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

errorNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for error notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

eventEndpointURL.description:
Event endpoint URL.
The HTTP integration will POST all events to this enpoint. The request
will contain a query parameters "event" containing the type of the
event.

headers.description: The headers to use when making HTTP callbacks.

integrationNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for integration notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

joinNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for join notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

locationNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for location notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

statusNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for device-status notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

txAckNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for tx ack notifications (downlink acknowledged by gateway for transmission).
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

uplinkDataURL.description:
The URL to call for uplink data.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

totalCount.description: Total number of applications available within the result-set.
Total number of items in the queue.
Total number of devices available within the result-set.
Total number of devices for the FUOTA deployment.
Total number of deployments available within the result-set.
Total number of nodes available within the result-set.
Total number of integrations available within the result-set.
Total number of devices available within the result-set.
The total number of users in the organization.

dasGNSSPort.description:
Device Application Services GNSS port (FPort).
ChirpStack Application Server will forward the FRMPayload to DAS when
as GNSS payload when the uplink FPort is equal to this value.

dasGNSSUseRxTime.description:
Device Application Services GNSS use RX time.
In case this is set to true, the DAS resolver will use the RX time of the
network instead of the timestamp included in the LR1110 payload.

dasModemPort.description:
Device Application Services modem port (FPort).
ChirpStack Application Server will only forward the FRMPayload to DAS
when the uplink FPort is equal to this value.

dasStreamingGeolocWorkaround.description:
Device Application Services streaming geoloc work-around.
This is a temporarily work-around for processing streaming geolocation
data. When enabled, stream records (expected in TLV format) are scanned
for GNSS data (0x06 or 0x07). If found, the ChirpStack Application Server
will make an additional call to the DAS API for resolving the location
using the detected payload.

dasToken.description:
Device Application Services token.
This token can be obtained from the LoRa Cloud console.

geolocationBufferTTL.description:
Geolocation buffer TTL (in seconds).
When > 0, uplink RX meta-data will be stored in a buffer so that
the meta-data of multiple uplinks can be used for geolocation.

geolocationGNSSPayloadField.description:
GNSS payload field.
This holds the name of the field in the decoded payload object which
contains the GNSS payload bytes.

geolocationGNSSUseRxTime.description:
GNSS use RX time.
In case this is set to true, the resolver will use the RX time of the
network instead of the timestamp included in the LR1110 payload.

geolocationMinBufferSize.description:
Geolocation minimum buffer size.
When > 0, geolocation will only be performed when the buffer has
at least the given size.

geolocationToken.description:
Geolocation token.
This token can be obtained from the LoRa Cloud console.

geolocationWifiPayloadField.description:
Wifi payload field.
This holds the name of the field in the decoded payload object which
contains an array of objects with the following fields:
* macAddress - e.g. 01:23:45:67:89:ab
* signalStrength - e.g. -51 (optional)

jwt.description: The JWT tag to be used to access chirpstack-application-server interfaces.

applicationID.description:
Application ID.
After creation, this can not be updated.

id.description:
ID (string formatted UUID).
This will be generated automatically on create.

mcAppSKey.description: Multicast application session key (HEX encoded AES128 key).

mcNwkSKey.description: Multicast network session key (HEX encoded AES128 key).

pingSlotPeriod.description:
Ping-slot period.
Mandatory for Class-B multicast groups.

preambleSize.description:
RF preamble size .
Mandatory for Class-D multicast groups.

apiMulticastGroupType.description:
- CLASS_C: Class-C.
 - CLASS_B: Class-B.
 - CLASS_D: Class-D.

fCnt.description:
Downlink frame-counter.
This will be automatically set on enqueue.

gatewayDiscoveryDR.description: The data-rate of the gateway discovery 'ping'.

gatewayDiscoveryEnabled.description: Enable gateway discovery for this network-server.

gatewayDiscoveryInterval.description:
The number of times per day the gateway discovery 'ping' must be
broadcasted per gateway.

gatewayDiscoveryTXFrequency.description: The frequency (Hz) of the gateway discovery 'ping'.

routingProfileCACert.description:
Routing-profile ca certificate (used by the network-server to connect
back to the application-server) (optional).

routingProfileTLSCert.description:
Routing-profile TLS certificate (used by the network-server to connect
back to the application-server) (optional).

routingProfileTLSKey.description:
Routing-profile TLS key (used by the network-server to connect
back to the application-server) (optional).

tlsCert.description: TLS (client) certificate for connecting to the network-server (optional).

tlsKey.description: TLS (client) key for connecting to the network-server (optional).

jwtToken.description: JWT token to use for authentication.

canHaveGateways.description: Can the organization create and "own" Gateways?

maxDeviceCount.description:
Max. device count for organization.
When set to 0, the organization can have unlimited devices.

maxGatewayCount.description:
Max. gateway count for organization.
When set to 0, the organization can have unlimited gateways.

apiOrganizationLink.description: Defines an organization to which an user is associated.

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of this organization.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

canHaveGateways.description: Can the organization create and "own" Gateways?

email.description: Email (only used on get and when adding a user to an organization).

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of the organization.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of the organization.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

userID.description:
User ID.
This is not used on create, you must set the user email address
associated with the user to add an user to an organization.

altitude.description: Altitude of the gateway in meters.

organizations.description: Organizations to which the user is associated.

addGWMetaData.description: GW metadata (RSSI, SNR, GW geoloc., etc.) are added to the packet sent to AS.

channelMask.description: Channel mask. sNS does not have to obey (i.e., informative).

devStatusReqFreq.description: Frequency to initiate an End-Device status request (request/day).

dlRate.description: Token bucket filling rate, including ACKs (packet/h).

dlRatePolicy.description: Drop or mark when exceeding DLRate.

drMax.description: Maximum allowed data rate. Used for ADR.

drMin.description: Minimum allowed data rate. Used for ADR.

gwsPrivate.description:
Gateways under this service-profile are private.
This means that these gateways can only be used by devices under the
same service-profile.

id.description:
Service-profile ID (UUID string).
This will be automatically set on create.

networkServerID.description: Network-server ID on which the service-profile is provisioned.

organizationID.description: Organization ID to which the service-profile is assigned.

reportDevStatusBattery.description: Report End-Device battery level to AS.

ulRate.description: Token bucket filling rate, including ACKs (packet/h).

ulRatePolicy.description: Drop or mark when exceeding ULRate.

joinNonce.description: JoinNonce represents the join-nonceï¼ŒNote that the max value is 2^24 - 1 = 16777215.

nwkKey.description: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x, use this field for the LoRaWAN 1.0.x 'AppKey`!

fNwkSIntKey.description: Forwarding network session integrity key (HEX encoded).

sNwkSIntKey.description: Serving network session integrity key (HEX encoded).

payloadJSON.description: The event payload in JSON encoding.

id.description:
User ID.
Will be set automatically on create.

isActive.description: Set to false to disable the user.

isAdmin.description: Set to true to make the user a global administrator.

note.description: Optional note to store with the user.

id.description:
User ID.
Will be set automatically on create.

isActive.description: Set to false to disable the user.

isAdmin.description: Set to true to make the user a global administrator.

User is admin within the context of the organization.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

commonLocationSource.description:
- UNKNOWN: Unknown.
 - GPS: GPS.
 - CONFIG: Manually configured.
 - GEO_RESOLVER_TDOA: Geo resolver (TDOA).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_RSSI: Geo resolver (RSSI).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_GNSS: Geo resolver (GNSS).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_WIFI: Geo resolver (WIFI).

commonModulation.description:
- LORA: LoRa
 - FSK: FSK
 - LR_FHSS: LR-FHSS

gwCRCStatus.description:
- NO_CRC: No CRC.
 - BAD_CRC: Bad CRC.
 - CRC_OK: CRC OK.

delay.description:
Delay (duration).
The delay will be added to the gateway internal timing, provided by the context object.

antenna.description: The antenna identifier for emitting the frame.

board.description: The board identifier for emitting the frame.

context.description:
Gateway specific context.
In case of a Class-A downlink, this contains a copy of the uplink context.

gatewayID.description:
Gateway ID.
Deprecated: replaced by gateway_id in DownlinkFrame.

supportsClassD.description:

timing.description: Timing defines the downlink timing to use.

gwDownlinkTiming.description:
- IMMEDIATELY: Send the downlink immediately.
 - DELAY: Send downlink at the given delay (based on provided context).
 - GPS_EPOCH: Send at given GPS epoch value.

aesKeyIndex.description: AES key index used for encrypting the fine timestamp.

encryptedNS.description: Encrypted 'main' fine-timestamp (ns precision part of the timestamp).

gwFineTimestampType.description:
- NONE: No fine-timestamp available.
 - ENCRYPTED: Encrypted fine-timestamp.
 - PLAIN: Plain fine-timestamp.

time.description: RX time (only set when the gateway has a GPS module).

timeSinceGPSEpoch.description: RX time since GPS epoch (only set when the gateway has a GPS module).

uplinkID.description:
Uplink ID (UUID bytes).
Unique and random ID which can be used to correlate the uplink across multiple logs.

nsDeviceGatewayRXInfo.description:
DeviceGatewayRXInfo holds the meta-data of a gateway receiving the last
uplink message.
